intro: Chaenactis glabriuscula var. gracilenta, commonly known as the slenderleaf paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
